paragraphs.content: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?

paragraphs.content: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?

paragraphs.content: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?

paragraphs.content: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

paragraphs.content: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.

paragraphs.content: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

paragraphs.content: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

paragraphs.content: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.

paragraphs.content: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.

paragraphs.content: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.

paragraphs.content: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.

paragraphs.content: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.

paragraphs.content: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?
